channel.title: Amy Ingram on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Amy Ingram on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Mechanical slaves and the Californian ideology
item.description: Noted elsewhere, saved here for reference, from Richard Barbrook and Andy Cameron, THE CALIFORNIAN IDEOLOGY If human slaves are ultimately unreliable, then mechanical ones will have to be invented. The search for the holy grail of Artificial Intelligence reveals this desire for the Golem a strong and loyal slave whose skin is the colour of the earth and whose innards are made of sand. As in Asimovâ€™s Robot novels, the techno-utopians imagine that it is possible to obtain slave like labour from inanimate machines.

item.title: Your new robo-assistant, Amy Ingram
item.description: Every day, computers are making people easier and easier to use. (David Tempkin, In Formation) x.ai has a new service in development, an automated personal assistant that helps you schedule meetings. You give it - or I should say “her”, because the bot’s name is Amy Ingram - you give Amy your calendar and some simple instructions, and “she” manages the correspondence with the person you’re trying to meet with.
